sub_title: Secondary School Teacher, English, Peace and Justice, EPAS and E-twinning, Cambridge English.
summary:
My greatest asset is the rich variety of experience, projects and great people I have worked with, from grassroots movements to the senior teams of international organisations. 

It is this diversity that enables me to think "out of the box", making me a natural bridge builder and change agent.
 
My expertise in the Western Balkans is based on life-work experience and academic research and encompasses several areas:
- peacebuilding - first hand knowledge, network and research
- transitional justice 
- dynamics of the armed conflict
- challenges of peace building processes during the armed conflict 

In putting the knowledge and ideas into practice, I use the inventory of skills:
     - MANAGEMENT: projects, events, organisations
     - TEACHING - workshops, trainings, facilitation;
     - RESEARCH - research, analysis, writing;

projects.title: Booklet "Achter de deur van...", on residents of Centraal Wonen StadsOase
projects.description: A collection of portraits, an inventory of skills and interests of about 70 StadsOase residents: our booklet should be all of this. The aim of our project is to create a tool for encouraging creative exchanges, inspiring new activities, increasing social cohesion. With Frants Geraerds, Marieke Putman Cramer and Caren Apers.

contributors.headline: Secondary School Teacher, English, Peace and Justice, EPAS and E-twinning, Cambridge English.

projects.title: "Beyond ICTY" lecture series bringing prominent human rights activists from former Yugoslavia to ICTY
projects.description:
A series of lectures bringing prominent human rights activists from former Yugoslavia to address ICTY staff, realised with donations from “Humanity in Action”, 2003-2005; The purpose of this series was to raise awareness of the ICTY as an institution about the impact of local activists and to start cooperating with them as allies. Speakers  and subjects included: 

Vesna Terselic, Anti-War Campaign of Croatia, showed how actions of local NGOs influenced public opinion in Croatia sufficiently to make the prosecution of Croat war crimes against Serbs acceptable

Zarko Puhovski, Croatian Helsinki Committee for Human Rights “A Friendly Critique of the ICTY”

Natasa Kandic, Humanitarian Law Centre Belgrade “The ICTY and local NGOs – Cooperation for Reconciliation”

Marijana Senjak, Medica Zenica (Multi-Ethnic Therapy Centre for Women), Bosnia-Herzegovina,  “Victims and Witnesses – Their Role, Their Needs and Problems They Face”

Nenad Fiser, ICTY Leadership Research Team “Monitoring as the Essential Requirement for Lasting Peace” 

Lazar Stojanovic, filmmaker, OSCE – “Myths as Used to Justify Violence”

My contribution: idea, organising support for the concept within ICTY, consulting NGOs and human rights activists about the programme, obtaining permissions, organisational work. I would like to think that the first "Beyond ICTY" series made a contribution, however tiny, to a more integrative view on former Yugoslavia and raised awareness of the early local peace-building efforts.

Due to its success, a second series followed, this time with former Yugoslav and international speakers. Several screenings of documentary films, followed by discussions, were also organised, including: "Pine and fir trees" , a production of Zagreb Centre for Women Studies.

profile_positions.description:
English teacher within the English department of the Hague Montessori Lyceum (students aged 12-15). Regular lessons and Cambridge English.  Responsible for the programme of EU Master, part of the European Parliament Ambassador School Programme (EPAS).
Co-organising annual "Peace and Justice" project, a week of lectures, discussions and debates in June  (since June 2017).
profile_positions.title: Teacher - English, Cambridge English, Peace and Justice, EPAS programme, E-twinning

One year programme within English department of Hague Montessori Lyceum (students aged 12-18). Co-teaching programme 'Een tien voor Europa', part of European Parliament Ambassador School Programme (EPAS).
Co-organising "Peace and Justice" project, a week of lectures, discussions and debates in June 2017.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Intern

profile_positions.description:
Writing, lecturing, researching, organising, on volunteer basis. Institutions / groups I cooperated with include UN ICTY, Utrecht University, AEGEE Utrecht (European Students Forum), OBS Lucas van Leyden, CW Vereniging StadsOase.  As of 2016, I am member of the board of CW Stads Oase (bestuurslid). 
As of March 2016 exploring career options in education (Crash course in onderwijs, 2016, organised by Het Schoolbureau in cooperation with OSB, Open Schoolgemeenschap Bijlmer).
June 2016 starting with workshops Croatian for holidays:  https://www.facebook.com/kroatisch.op.vakantie/
profile_positions.title: Activity Coordinator, Language Coach, Researcher - exploring career change

profile_positions.description:
"Joint EU ICTY Training Project for Visiting National Prosecutors and Visiting Young Professionals" aims to strengthen capacity of prosecution authorities in post Yugoslav countries, by providing 24-26 legal professionals from the region with paid internships at ICTY. Supported by donations from European Commission, with an annual budget of 400,000 euros. 

In 2013-2014: succesfully combining ICTY work with study (MA Conflict Studies and Human Rights, Utrecht University).
profile_positions.title: EU Project Management Assistant/  Immediate Office of the Prosecutor

profile_positions.description: Transition Team focused on cooperation with regional prosecution authorities in the post Yugoslav countries. The highly international team consisted of lawyers, research assistants, analysts and language assistants. My duties included targeted search for evidence, translations and acting as focal point for questions related to former "Rules of the Road" project.
profile_positions.title: Bi-lingual Research Assistant and Translator, Transition Team, Office of the Prosecutor

profile_positions.description: "Rules of the Road"​ was a judicial mechanism established after Dayton Peace Accords, to secure legal standards for local war crimes prosecutions in Bosnia-Herzegovina. The Project team consisted of 3-5 English speaking lawyers and 6 "language assistants" (bi-lingual research assistants) with knowledge of Bosnian-Serbian-Croatian. Language Assistants analysed war crimes files and produced English summaries for lawyers, taking into account all relevant evidence and cultural translation. We also initiated and took part in the major re-design of the project database (2003), assisted with organisation of the ICTY Outreach Meeting in 1998 and ROR conferences in Sarajevo and Banja Luka in 2001.
profile_positions.title: Bi-lingual Research Assistant ("Language Assistant") and Translator, "Rules of the Road" Project

profile_positions.description:
I have learned more in 18 months of EYFA than in years elsewhere. With its European network of about 200 youth organisations focusing on environment, sustainable development, alternative energy and social justice, EYFA was collection of talent, enthusiasm, knowledge, commitment, diversity and innovation. I learned about using creative tools to explore project options, facilitating large meetings in several different languages, consensus building, team building, office management, working with volunteers and paid staff and challenged my organisational skills at annual summer universities gathering up to 200 young people from all over Europe. 

Highlights: EYFA Women's Project and EYFA Gender Seminar (conflict resolution across gender and East/West cultural lines), organised with generous donation of the Council of Europe in Budapest, March 1997. The Seminar and follow-up activities inspired participants to organise similar workshops upon return to their own country
profile_positions.title: Office Manager (shared) - Course Director for Gender Seminar

profile_positions.description: This small, all-female international team focused on empowering young women in Eastern Europe. Activities were organised in close cooperation with local grassroots groups, with generous donation of Phare Tacis. Central European Seminar on media skills for young women activists was organised with Szuzana Iskierska in Krakow, February 1996.
profile_positions.title: Young Women and Democracy Project - Co-organiser Central European Seminar

profile_positions.description:
UNPROFOR Peace Keeping Mission in former Yugoslavia, Mission Headquarters and Pleso Camp: working as Secretary/Interpreter for Chief of Administrative Services, Finnish Battalion and Engineering Operations Section (section providing engineering support to all UN basis in the mission, with locations throughout Croatia and Bosnia). 

Highlights:  taking part in the start up of EOS in late 1993, growing to the main, Pleso-based team of 20 and hundreds of engineering personnel throughout the mission.
profile_positions.title: Administrative Assistant - Bilingual Secretary- Interpreter

profile_positions.description: Secretarial support for small, 5-people office of representation of three transnational companies in Belgrade. Bi-lingual, French and Serbian. Additional responsibility for the Rhône-Poulenc part of the office as sales assistant, requesting and passing the offers. The office closed in July 1992, due to the introduction of the UN economic sanctions.
profile_positions.title: Bilingual Secretary - Sales Assistant

company.name: "Bozidar Adzija" Cultural Institute, International Business Center Belgrade

profile_positions.company: "Bozidar Adzija" Cultural Institute, International Business Center Belgrade
profile_positions.description:
Free-lance teaching by giving private lessons as a way of acquiring practice in educational skills while doing my academic studies. 
In the academic year 1989-1990 (during the year of leave from exams) I worked full time for institute "Bozidar Adzija", teaching English to pre-schoolers aged 4-6. I stopped this in order to focus on my final exams. In November and December 1991 I taught business English to adult groups at International Business Centre in Belgrade.
profile_positions.title: Teacher of English and French

volunteer_experiences.description: Initiating and (co)organising workshops and events for children and parents, aiming to contribute to social cohesion and creativity in centraal wonen complex. Annual financial and activity reports.

Assisting and accompanying groups of pupils during sport day, field trips, visits to musea and other events. Helping with creative workshops at school and organisation of the annual "project presentation" open day (involving 800 visitors), etc.
